body: What levels would you want to specify this on? Per-map, profile, global...?

I was following along the original Google thread at https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!topic/automapper-users/3Sw6u9PQ41o but missed your request there to add an issue, so I'll just contribute here.

Per-map would be fine for us; sometimes we want to use it with just public properties, but in the scenario where we are mapping internal DTOs we want to hide outside the assembly, we'd like to be able to use it there.

Hi Jimmy:

Personally, I'd like a global setting.  If I'm consuming an API and using an adapter to map its fields into my domain model, I would like to make the web reference that consumes the API an internal one, so that my domain model can't get mixed up with the external DTOs.

Per-map and profile would be nice-to-haves, though.

Do you accept submissions from minions?

To be clear, we're also okay with whatever is easiest. Global is what we are doing in our private fork, we didn't make it configurable so it's not submission quality. We just want to rejoin the AutoMapper NuGet family.
I see this issue is still open.  Was this ever implemented?

Nope, not yet. I'll close the issue when it is.

On Fri, Sep 14, 2012 at 8:26 AM, bbakkebo notifications@github.com wrote:

> I see this issue is still open. Was this ever implemented?
> 
> â€”
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/218#issuecomment-8560798.

Jimmy,

+1 on the issue and +1 on whatever configuration level you consider easiest to implement. Thanks for the great tool!

Any progress on this?
+1 on allowing mapping of internal members
Would really love to have internal (and private) properties mappable without resorting to implementing custom mappings for every internal/private property.

issue.title: Added a new mapping expression - IgnoreAllPropertiesWithAnInaccessibleSetter()
issue.body:
IgnoreAllPropertiesWithAnInaccessibleSetter() supports scenarios where the destination type contains several properties with private or protected setters that should not be mapped from the source type.

I added a test class with four "facts" for this, and they all pass. I also added summary documentation.

This addresses https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/187 (and it appears to be related to https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/173 and https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/218).

(Note: I previously submitted a pull request with a different solution involving an overload to AssertConfigurationIsValid(), but I believe this is a better solution because it allows more fine-grained control and doesn't make any existing methods obsolete. I also managed not to screw up the line endings this time :))

body: This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
